BDu2FE9YG-rGZy_A8rHPCA.text: awesome service! great food and no matter how busy this place gets, the wait is never long! mad PROPS to the staff for their enduring commitment to serving the community a great product!!

TrYB37pDDfexQevIuZHRuQ.text: Today was my first time visiting Sunflower restaurant and the service was HORRIBLE. The food was good. Unfortunately, the customer service was terrible. Our waitress was amazing, but the hostess and cashier was rude, irritable, and unprofessional. Prior to being seated, the hostess rolled her eyes as we counted the number of people in our party. This type of body language will make anyone feel very uncomfortable and unwanted. After spending $50 & leaving our waitress a tip well over 20%, I purchased fried shrimp to-go and sat in the chairs in front of the register and waited for my order to be provided to me. The waitress walked by and told me that it would be ready in 10 minutes. I waited 15 minutes and politely asked the cashier if she could provide me with an estimated wait time for my order. She told me that it takes 10 minutes to be cooked. I told her that it had been 15 minutes & her exact response was "Well we are busy and there is nothing that I can do about that. You'll have to wait." Which I didn't mind doing, but her attitude was unnecessary. She forcely pushed the kitchen door open, came back, & told me that it would be 2 minutes. Another 10 minutes goes by.. as I waited I watched the cashier process cash transactions without making eye contact nor smiling at customers. I also saw someone place my food on a shelf under the register area, but I didn't say anything. I waited for the cashier to notice. She finally noticed, with no smile, no apology for the delay she said "You paid for this right?" I responded yes ma'am with a smile and she practically threw the food in my hands. At that point, I did not want the food anymore so I asked for a refund. The cashier called the hostess over who just so happens to be her mom and her mom said, "Well she paid for it so what's the problem? Go tell your dad." The waitress went in the kitchen, came back, & processed my refund. There was a party standing at the counter that complained of bad service as well, which is sad because I've heard so many good things about their restaurant. Unfortunately, my experience wasn't the same as others. Their first impressions made a lasting impression and I will never eat there again! Advice: Great customer service is the key to a thriving Organization. The cashier lacks proper customer service skills, but obviously is overworked & may need some help. Today might have just been a bad day, but regardless of the day you're having or how busy it is that shouldnt affect the way that you treat customers.

8YAgNFA_bxrZqN01IH1p8Q.text: Very good southern fare. Definitely worth a try. The chicken fried steak was excellent.

U9VkkvDYAkRSueXiTP1qTw.text: Always my favorite place for breakfast. Alas they will not be open on  Sundays anymore. MY CHILDREN WILL  Either be eating Cheerios or nothing. This is my go to spot when I don't want to cook a Sunday Breakfast.  Whoa is me. John (LOVE YOU)  Can we add home fries to the menu? Just asking. Sunflower is like my home away from home on afternoons I am home alone and haven't eaten. The apple topped pancake will cuddle you right up. I am getting the spinach feta today. If you wants some. Get in your buggy and go go go gadget!!!

Ui_JpBDF0af_XKC-Iii8Sw.text: Love this place! Great food and I love the owners and staff! Whenever we go in they know us and always make us feel very welcomed!

UbLsKFtZMoBJ_zRF63vdvQ.text: Small restaurant located in a trailer, no worries there since they can actually seat 4 at a time at a table or booth.  The food is delish and you get quite a bit for your $$$.  An order of fish and grits includes 2 pieces of fried fish, grits 2 eggs and toast for roughly $7.99!  oh  yeahhhhh

FObtBBAVwUNVu4EUWvH-OA.text: I love this place. It's kind of small and they are always busy. The owner comes around to ensure everyone is taken care of. Although it's busy, your food comes out promptly. I've never had an issue with my order. You get so much food for a decent price. I'm just sad that they are closed on Sunday's now. Very friendly staff with a down home atmosphere. I'm a Charlotte native and haven't found a place that has it all ( friendly staff, quick service, great atmosphere, and a concerned owner who values each customer). They are unmatched. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

jObk_4YsFmf0z7H0qG_e8g.text: This place is a great hole in the wall! My favorite type of place to eat! I've been going here for years and the food is consistently good. They have a very eclectic menu... Everything from southern, to Greek, and some Italian. Their daily specials have so much food! Great prices too! Breakfast all day is always a plus, for me! Their French toast is amazing! Come early because the place fills up fast. They are quick though, and the servers are attentive.

3CE5uEn6KYCfCMguo9gyvQ.text: Great little restaurant in middle of a busy street. Must try. We will have to go back for there fish it looked amazing. We went for breakfast and regret not ordering the fish.

prbT4y1Bc5MprI8cQS8-IA.text: Excellent service and the food was plentiful and really really good!! Oh man that breakfast was perfect. I tried this time the Spanish Omelette with the sauce on top. Yummy!! Prices are also right in.

I_g-MikPKqOkDB1XQVrWBw.text: Small place open until 2 pm. they serve breakfast and lunch. grits was creamy with lots of butter delish.  hubby had pancakes with hashbrowns.  good portions with good prices.  Looks like alot of locals go there.  Service is very friendly.Will try the lunch next time.

942KrRogQaYB5lym2WFD7A.text: This little restaurant right off Statesville road, next to a gas station doesn't look like much, but wow is it amazing. Food is reasonably priced, portions are large, and the staff is amazing. One of my new favorite restaurants. You better come hungry though. They serve breakfast all day (which is amazing) and have great specials throughout the week. They've been open for 13 years according to one of the workers (may have been manager or owner), and I believe they'll be open for a lot longer if they keep up what they're doing.

ANVEcNV3pbwLDWdSCW1rbQ.text: Great food and service and the decor reminds me of the beach. This is the only breakfast place in the area though and fairly small, so you'll probably have a wait depending on what time you arrive.

5UV89oExhi_lmInZjejqcQ.text: Southern food at its finest. It's a meat plus three type restaurant that will leave you feeling full and uncomfortable the rest of the day from all the food you try to finish. I got the Bologna burger with chili and subbed the fries and slaw for mashed potatoes and gravy and fried okra for an extra $1. Also had the vegetable soup. I ate about half and felt really full. Leftovers the next day tasted even better. This place is very affordable. You could definitely split an entree here for the amount of food you get. In and out in under in hour during lunch.

sh6FHhOudRVc_QTzsbA1Zw.text: Solid Grady spoon establishment.  Quick service, wide selection, and the food tastes good.  Be sure to slow down on Statesville road.  You very well might drive right past this place if your not careful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bomb

8aLyv4lOnrdQ1JG8S0W6ww.text: Good food, great biscuits, huge portions, good service. Service was rendered at a reasonable speed for the crowd. The biscuits were light and fluffy I truly enjoyed mine.

ACduj5mgm_k9o9CqOX30Pw.text: The Greek omelette was the best I have ever had!!!  Even better than that was the genuinely warm and friendly mood of the place. Felt like I was having breakfast at my Grandmother's!!!

2FR0kmgEfLQWXwUatZTPIg.text: So yummy and kind service. Take your appetites though. Huge servings. Thank you for awesome food!

QzX7XUlbx8SwNkjPtRXirQ.text: Popular and busy local diner outside of Charlotte.   Large lunch menu consisted of classic American dishes with southern treats.   Hamburger steak, hot cakes, collard greens, fried okra and veggie beef soup were all delicious with satisfying portions and reasonable prices.  Friendly, efficient service. Worth visiting if you're in the area.

Z5rczl62Yql8IRyJwDuQtw.text: I just love this resturant. I have been going here for years. It doesn't matter how long I stay away, the owner knows my voice on my over the phone orders. I place a lot of phone orders. When i walk into the resturant, i am greeted by the waitresses and they are so polite and nice. They seat me and my party down if I am eating in and if I have a call in order they assist me almost immediately. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. The breakfast is awesome and under $10 four 2 meals, you can't beat that. Over the past four years I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. It is by far the best breakfast spot ever!!!!!!!!  Once I had to go into the restaurant and wait on 2 other people to come and the waitresses we're very polite. They did not rush me and they did not rush us to finish eating once my party did arrived.

b3XLm0tjUv98uuS2f7jmdA.text: This is the best brunch breakfast lunch Place in Charlotte North Carolina do not sleep on this place the service is excellent the food is excellent fresh grape portion size delicious whenever I visit Charlotte this is my number one stop in when I get there and when I leave I love that place if they had a t-shirt for restaurants I will wear their t-shirt proudly

m_4mK4kFRuWI_qxTAZA9xA.text: I'm not going to judge on my first trip but my husband and I were not impressed. I ordered biscuits and gravy w/bacon and eggs, my husband ordered a rib eye w/grits and eggs. My biscuits were burnt and hard. The gravy was not sausage gravy but had a few crumbled pieces of sausage on top. My husband's "rib eye" was a slim fatty piece of meat that was even saved by Hentz 57 sauce. The atmosphere is great and the staff was great. They knew guests names when they walked in the door. We'll give it another try another day.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great atmosphere

OCRr2AX4I-3IBrYDGke6GA.text: Sunflower is the BEST homestyle breakfast/lunch place in Charlotte NC! My husband and I frequent this place often. I love bringing friends there for the first time, they are ALWAYS pleasantly suprised! A few weeks ago, I came with a group of 16, anyone who has been to Sunflower knows that isn't the place to bring a big group and expect to sit together. That Saturday morning, the staff was beyond accommodating! We were able to sit together as a group and our food was brought out as fast as it is when I am in a party of 2. All 16 of our orders were correct. I expected nothing less. Thank you Sunflower for being amazing as always!

1kshknyIPtNcXEzVzRHC7Q.text: Home style breakfast food with great service. It's not spectacular but will leave you feeling good and the staff are excellent. The grits really make it. I would go back in a heartbeat.

ca1vkgwV3244dvSsTIPCZA.text: We stopped here to try something different and our expectations were exceeded.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  Definitely coming back!

baC7apOH1D2aW0CA3gZjTQ.text: I was told about this place from a friend and decided to give it a try. I was impressed with the food, customer service and atmosphere at this location.  Since that time I have returned with others and they were also impressed with   the overall visit. Needess to say I will be returning and it will be today.

N7E9Z41hwK3l1OO44FoBkA.text: I had a horrible and totally unexpected experience today at this restaurant with my daughter. The manger Dora was very rude. Upon paying for my food I advised the manger that my daughter had spilled her milk and ask if she could replace my daughter  to go cup of milk.The manger said since you are no longer at the table we cannot replace it.  I advise it was just given to her in a to go cup from your waitresse. The manger still refused to replace my daughter milk as I was proceeding to pay for our meal which was a total of $31. As the waitress started to clean up the table she said " oh her milk spilled let me run and get your daughter another one". The manger Dora heard the waitress and said " no they have gotten up from the table no need to replace her milk". After experiencing this rude customer service experience from the manger Dora this will be the last time I will be patronizing this restaurant.

DUlo2e8MeMTz2_W2ElYC6g.text: So we have been here 3 times, so i can give a fair review. Love it. Its a mom and pop style diner. The food is excelent and the staff was great. I only have one complaint. The hot sauce.. lol i hate texas pete so ill have to bring my own lol. Other then that outstanding. Ill post pics of the food next week. This will be out new once a week .

pHuB_nelVZjSkQCGeK43LA.text: You will not find better home cooking anywhere in town and it's a bargain too. Fast service, kind staff and good food it's a shame they aren't open for dinner!

14ktyiB_1T12c3iSumkx7A.text: First time having breakfast here and I loved it! Price is a little higher than the other breakfast restaurant I go to down the street from here but I can understand why...the quality of the food was good. Especially the salmon cake that I had. I loved the grits also. I also got waffles to go for my daughter and she really like it. The place is small, so it does get crowded, but it's worth it. I will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

tkD73X61qLW32J2aFitoZg.text: We use to really like this place. But the overly salty food has us both dizzy after we leave. To me they really used too much sodium. One time the soup wasn't good and we complained to have it changed and then the owner came out to tell us it tasted fine to him. After that experience that had been our last time there. The staff is always been friendly and there's usually never a wait for food but after the few times I've having bad experiences we have decided to find closer and better establishments.

bHIDBhFMnss19DieBx0Idw.text: The rating speaks for itself. This place is an excellent breakfast spot. Excellent. I went two days in a row because day one was great. Even the coffee is great. Don't question your decision to go here. Just go.

1cLUGoQt3kIwhXOxkR2Ssg.text: I love this restaurant. Every meal is cooked with love. The owners are genuine. They treat you like a guest in their house. The food is delicious no matter what I try. It started as me getting an invite at my register while working at sams club. It's been twelve years and I'm still coming. I introduced my other half and he love it. No matter what I try, I am overly satisfied. It's always a full house. It's worth every second

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

jben1gzjq9ELtvthxdAP6g.text: We are visiting the area for the All Star race this weekend & wanted to check out some local Mom & Pop places & we hit the jackpot! The restaurant was so neat & tidy on the outside & very warm & welcoming inside. Our server was Sue & she was great! Very friendly & her recommendations & suggestions were spot on! We wouldn't hesitate to come back here!

iPaQ76rsU6T5Wu-HDlKQfA.text: Best breakfast and lunch in Charlotte . Service is fast and the tea is sweet. I could eat here 7 days a week and get something different everyday and it would be good

yt95Owz0_QkDTr3LAT0U8w.text: The owner is very rude. They messed up our order and he was blaming us for that. The place had a dead roach in the corner of the restaurant. We walked out of the place. Very dirty place, rude owner, and horrible food. I highly suggest you go to McDonald's before coming here.

xJYONkzLX9FoHG5ndYH0AQ.text: Philly Cheesesteak to die for! I was pleasantly surprised at both the service and food quality. Looks like it's a place the locals gather. I hope to be back for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

StWYCVlftSf4o2dwoOKiZQ.text: Surprisingly great food and service. This place doesn't look like much but it is excellent. The prices are fair and the service and food are outstanding. I will definitely stop in next time I'm in Charlotte.

j8tiWFpj5F4ZOr1z8YqxWQ.text: Best breakfast sandwiches around for less than $5! Lots of bacon, substantial amount of egg... delicious !! Have gotten these the last two days in a row! Not to mention their vegetable beef soup, and also the chicken and rice soup both get 2 thumbs up from me!

0nBR6BKnvLRtmoucL4NRCA.text: Food is plentiful and fresh. Great deals for the quantity they serve you. Friendly staff. Always packed. Their salads are amazing and the same thing I always get. Thanks Amanda for your attentiveness to the order

NuH-EJRfKaIWMfoCojdFPg.text: I've lived in this area for about 8 years and have passed this place hundreds of times.  One day my husband decided to surprise me with breakfast and I had no idea it was from here.  Boy, we have been missing out!!!  I've always seen this place packed each time I have driven past it and always thought to myself that I'll go there one day.  The grits, egg whites, and turkey sausage are my favorite items from here as well as the fried apple sticks.  I prefer cooking my own grits as usually when I order them in a restaurant, I have to doctor them up.  Well... that's not the case with the grits from here!  I did not have to add anything to these grits, which is an A++ in my book (lol).    My husband and I are hooked and are fans of this place.  We have yet to try the other dishes, but we're completely sold on the breakfast.  The prices are very reasonable and the food portions are great, so you do get your money's worth (I can only speak for breakfast, that is).  We usually call ahead and place our order and it's always piping hot when we pick it up.  I have a list of favorite breakfast spots here in Charlotte, but this one is definitely in my top 3!!!

YG8ZlIR4G5Tcwu-dN-Pliw.text: I went to this restaurant for the first time a few weeks ago and I was impressed with the service and the food. I will be going back again and telling my friends about this hidden gem!!!!!

lF-s4o0clnlAWZ5BqzzgDg.text: Food was excellent, i had the super scramble and it was delicious and plenty! Our server was excellent and very attentive! The place was busy but food came out fast and we were seated quickly as well! Id definitely return!

BSiQKoB4vvsHRGlRJ3dzfA.text: Love the diner feel here! Definitely a mom and pop joint that should be around forever. Seating was quick even during rush hour lunch. Service was impeccable, constantly asking if we need anything and re-filling our water. Staff here work really hard churning tables to get customers seated right away.  I ordered the bologna burger w fries and had my co worker's chicken soup. The soup was so hearty! Def worth getting. And the bologna was the thickest I've ever seen. Best part about the burger is they added chili and fried pickles! Really juicy and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. chicken soup
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Balogna burger

ocg1dFzT_hEh6aQ8sEdf0w.text: I'm giving them five stars, not because it's the best food I've ever had.. it's because it's genuinely just /good/ food and they deserve it. A from your mama or grandmama's kitchen kind of good. It's absolutely reliable. I would know... I go to this place minimum once a week and feel negligent for not haven written them a good review sooner.  Everything I've gotten has been great. You're going to want to try those fried pork chops. The salads are big enough that it's a challenge to finish it. The soups ALWAYS taste home made, not just some junk out of a can. This place will give you the warm fuzzies of a home cooked meal. The service is always great. There's this beautiful little greek lady running the front end of the place that always remembers our names and our common orders. These people deserve your business for lunch/breakfast.   You won't be disappointed. It gets packed though around noon, (because it's so good, obviously) but the waitresses and cooks get people in and out quickly. Comfort food at its best. Healthy options, too. Enjoy!

D_eYrM8ql110bL_U08T_hw.text: I am not sure why people are giving this place all these excellent ratings. When you cook well this place is an turnoff. The city rated it a 95.5 and that is deceiving.  Pro: Kitchen from the view of the back door on the side seemed to be very clean. Large portions.  Cons:  Food is not good. It you like bland and unseasoned food this is your spot. They charge you for everything.  Parking is barely any.  Bathrooms are small.   Suggestions:  Change cooks.  Change locations or at least buy some more space for parking.  By all means get some tables that match the width and length of the patrons.

M5QgRotJxiqgRU0grX-u_w.text: I think it was second or third visit, where I overheard a conversation between a waitress and a customer and he was saying how he had just come yesterday and that he loved their food and the waitress responded by saying, "We don't have one time customers." And this my yelp friends is so accurate.  The breakfast here wins me over. It is affordable, it is good eats and feels like home. They always over a daily special. Last visit, I had sausage patties, grits and 2 eggs and white toast for $3.99. They have a vast option of breakfast items and their omelets are pretty good. They aren't overcooked and come in many varieties. It must be a southern thing but if you want fish for breakfast, you can get it here too.   We recently tried their chicken fried steak and it was not so traditional but very delicious. It was well seasoned, juicy and crispy. The grits are always creamy and well cooked. Served plain so you can season any way you want, sweet or savory.   They are only open for breakfast and lunch. And depending on the time you go can be very busy. I was shocked at how busy they get. They have definitely have their stream of regulars. I mean the food is good.   Very easy to call in and pick up your food too. This is definitely a rotation in my family outings. My son loves this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fried steak with grits and over easy eggs and biscuits. My gravy is not pictured as it was in a separate container.
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef tip salad. Lots of meat, little lettuce.
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. You just can&#39;t go wrong with the breakfast special for $3.99 (weekdays only)

qIUe5OPDD29Yb7jtxLNnKg.text: The food is really good, however on several occasions I have witnessed waitresses handle money, use markers, and then proceed to toss bread or biscuits in your to go container with there bare hands. They don't wash their hands or put gloves on. I witnessed the cook this morning rub food on his shirt, touch his hair and did not wash his hands, he had no gloves on to change. Although I love the food, this will be my last time coming. The thought of getting sick scares me. Owner are wonderful people and very friendly, I hope they will talk to their employees and reiterate the importance of cleanliness when dealing with food that's being sold to their customers of many years.

oyn4AEHZ0MyA9jClGJyxEg.text: Great food. Jamie was a sweet and attentive waitress. Kind of noisy but not excessive.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

17kth0mCu-ARKxsMyHxdoA.text: This place is simple and soooooo good. Stopped for breakfast, got a special of sausage patties, scrambled eggs, cheese grits and hashbrowns.  Tasty! Everything looked so good that I forgot to take a pic and dug right in!!! The portions were generous and the staff was friendly.  They even had a fish variety available for breakfast.  Crab cakes, croaker, perch etc. I'll be getting that next time.  I noticed there were 2 other tables with first timers like myself enjoying their food while declaring the place their "new" spot.  All I could do was chew and nod in agreement.

ss58svJIXsT3ybUuCLklIA.text: This restaurant may look rough from the outside, but it has a cozy inside. The service was terrific and the food was served in nice portions. The food tasted great and I would definitely eat here again.

GdT2Sz1k8T4EeT8h8edYNg.text: First Time Visit today but definitely not going to be the last.  I've wanted to try this restaurant for a number or years but finally got around to trying it today.  Cool wet August for a change and not much else planned on the agenda.  Greek immigrants and their decedents play a major role in the Charlotte Dining scene.  For a long time, they would open either an Italian Restaurant or a Southern Style Restaurant based on the traditional comfort foods we grew up on.  This is one of the later.  Drove down to the restaurant which is in the Nevins area of Charlotte although normally listed as Derita.  It's a small building on the East Side of Statesville Road a little over mile North of the junction with I-85. Building is Red and White although I remember back when it was Green and Yellow.  You have to look carefully to find the restaurant because the Marquee out front is so faded, you can hardly make out the name of the restaurant.  We got there around 12:30 and it was packed. They are only open till 2:00 pm Monday thru Saturday and closed on Sunday.  They were extremely busy and we had to wait a couple of minutes for the hostess to set us but in that time, I had occasion to observe a very well run restaurant.  As soon as one table became open, they rushed on the table to clean and sanitize it and get it ready for the next table. They are also very well staffed and the servers are all well trained and experienced.  We were seated in a small booth and our server Missy was there shortly to take our drink order. I ordered unsweet tea with lemon and she volunteered that did not have lemon but offered an Arnold Palmer heavy on the tea part that worked fine.  The servers support each other and if my glass every got low, Missy or another server would check by to insure that we were fine.  The menu is very large and extensive and they serve breakfast all day till they close at 2PM.  I decided on one of the Saturday Specials which was Fried or Grilled Pork Chops with two sides.  I had the Chop Fried and Fried Okra and Apple Cobbler as my two sides.  My wife went with the Roast Beef with Mash Potatoes and Gravy and Apple Cobbler as her sides.  They also offered a choice of two soups and we both ordered the Vegetable Beef Soup.  The soup came out in a few minutes and it was great. Plenty of meat and perfectly cooked vegetables that had not been rendered to a mush.  Came out piping hot and was fresh.  I so inspired me that this evening I went to Publix and bought the ingredients to make a batch on my own tomorrow.  Lunch came out shortly thereafter and they do not skimp on portion sizes.  The Pork Chops were perfect. Nice and moist under a generous breading full of flavor. Not the least bit dry. The Okra was perfect and still a bit crispy and not overcooked as you find it in most places.  Not a big desert fan but the Apple Cobbler was outstanding.  My wife loved her Roast Beef and again portion sizes are amazing. Potatoes were great with a generous amount of gravy and she felt the same about the Cobbler.  By the time we left, she was already planning what she was going to order on our next trip.  Busy place but at the same time, great food and service and while a bit noisy, a very popular local place.  I'm with my wife and we will be back in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable Beef Soup
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Pork Chops, Fried Okra and Apple Cobbler
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roast Beef, Mashed Potatoes with Gravy and Apple Cobbler

jgkGjSq5kQbwNYmCMXXdKg.text: One does not go here for a high-end fine dining luxury experience.  But if one wants good stick-to-your-ribs-just-like-your-momma-might-make food one does dine here.    When you pull up you can tell you are about to step back in time!  It's simple, cluttered with nostalgic touches and loud with the chatter of what you can tell are locals who would rather eat with the sunflower family rather than in their own kitchen but want the food to taste like it came from their kitchen.  SPOT ON!  While the exterior is nothing to write home about it does welcome you in with porch seating and a view of the busy road it sets on but I kinda like that.  :)  When you step in you can tell it is a family owned spot where they care more about how you feel and that you enjoy the food than that you ate or drank from an overpriced piece of pottery.  This is plain simple food folks at it best.  Anytime you see bologna on the menu you know its good simple food.    My hubby had the fried fish and grits meal with toast and I had the corned-beef hash (straight out of a can but I ain't mad at it) with eggs and grits.  They put a lil crisp on that canned hash and sat my over medium eggs on there with yellow stone grits and I was one happy camper.  One NOTE - do not salt your grits before tasting I made that mistake and they were almost too salty to eat since they come well seasoned already.    The place was bustling and I enjoyed every LOUD minute of it.  I wish I was a fly on the wall to hear all the wonderful stories being shared and made in this "step back in time" place.    When you want to keep it simple and good and fill up for less than $10 let the SunFlower family help you out.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. exterior
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. exterior
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. you can see it but under the eggs are corn-beef hash with the grits

nTsCvjMimQBfdIwRyr4xqw.text: A diamond in the rough! The food was absolutely delicious and the service was great! The crowd kept coming and the food kept flowing. We had the flounder, grits, corn beef hash, pancakes and bacon. We couldn't even eat it all the portions were so large! Great place for an inexpensive meal.

0dcaS4b1_nQAOefzh-5HcQ.text: From my opinion this is a hidden gem in plain sight. My daughter and I between basketball games(New Life Fellowship, 1337 Samuel Street) right down the stree was looking for a close by breakfast spot.  Thus place had great reviews on Yelp, do we tried it. I am so glad we tried Sunflower Restaurant.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I ordered the Farmers Omelet with hashbrowns and my daughter ordered the short stack with bacon. My server was very pleasant and attentive. My food was very tasty and served warm. My daughter said the bacon was a little greasy for her but the pancakes were good. It was served with warm syrup  I will definitely try Sunflower again and I will bring the rest of the family.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short stack (two pancakes) no powdered sugar and a side of bacon.
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Famers(mushroom, onions,peppers,onions) three egg omelet, hashbrowns, toast.
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

PYCO1qIGNzTPzjSi56y4uA.text: Omg this place is so yummy! The service is fast even though they are slammed all the time. My husband has been here multiple times and finally convinced me to come and I am so glad he did. We had the waffles, biscuits and gravy, and the bacon and egg on toast and on croissant. Each dish was so good. The waffles are warm and cuddly with sugar crystals throughout, the biscuits and gravy I have to say are my favorite, and the bacon is thick and crispy. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffles
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon and Egg on Toast

gi4tdFT0irFn8vM4TLX2eA.text: Sunflower is one of the best kept secrets in Charlotte!! I have yet to have something here I didn't like and I eat here at least once a week. The owners, Dora and George are awesome and their staff is amazing.  The portion sizes are HUGE, the prices are small and the food is perfection. There will be something for everyone here.

8Al-Jx8GztzlaeQfzqN0vg.text: This is my favorite restaurant right now. It's near the place I started working in November 2018 and since trying it in December I have eaten here several times both dine in and to go. I tend to get something different off the daily specials menu each time I'm there and it has all tasted homemade and great. Their burgers weren't as great as their home cooking entrees but they were still pretty good. Even with the small crowded parking lot I'm still giving this place 5 stars for being clean, fast, affordable and having good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

VrGZ6v2QDN2bVIwk9Stvpg.text: This place is a gem! The selections were amazing. I had the grits and nothing was needed. They were seasoned perfectly. It's this a must if you've never tried it.

-GjcxWoAYKCpLCh2aQnn7g.text: This is just what it is purported to be: a well functioning diner.  It's a spot that you may expect to see on the famous show about diners and dives!  Yes, the parking lot is very tight.  Yes, there are rules to follow here.  For example, my lunch companion, Toni, arrived a few minutes before I did, but couldn't be seated prior to my arrival.  These are small prices to pay to dine in such a funky and good place.  Where else can you go with deer heads flanking the wall, alongside funny little relics and clever little signs?   For me, breakfast was the star of the show today. I had a veggie omelet with some turkey sausage.   They brought a heap of cheesy grits (delicious) and a basket of different kinds of toast.   I regret that I didn't try their apple sticks, but maybe that's a compelling reason for me to return.  It was very crowded and a bit loud, but somehow that added to the spunk of the joint.  The service was good and this is one of the more memorable places I have been in awhile.  My only suggestion is for them to stock Sweet and Low.  I don't like the yellow packets in my iced tea.   I never understand why restaurants won't just stock all the sweeteners.  It can't cost them a lot of extra coins, but would make a lot of patrons even happier.  Regardless, two thumbs up.  Go for both the food and the experience!  Tell the deer heads that I said hello.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

I6sfc7ZZ9Ri7fLmkD78XLA.text: Unassuming little place, not much parking up front but there's room out back. Came in for breakfast around 6:00am and found the place well lit and cheerful (but not too cheerful) and with a little effort we mananged a table for six. Fresh black coffee was quick to the table and kept hot and filled throught breakfast. Special was Eggs and Grits and biscuit with choice of bacon, sausage, livermush, or Spam so I went  with the Spam. A hot plate full of food arrived shortly: I generally prefer my spam medium-well with some crispied outside and hot inside but didn't think to ask (didnt think I had to, but it's the south...) Eggs up are easy wreck but these were delish: set whites with warm, soft, runny, yolks just begging for hot sauce and crumbled biscuit bits. Firm, creamy grits covered half my plate and didn't need any help, no salt, no pepper, no butter, just a fork. Fresh hot moist biscuits...

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee with eggs and grits and spam and biscuits and grits
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. in back on the left, opposite of where you came in...
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. bright but not too bright dining room

Lg71iW5tjmX3vpkdaO6K-w.text: Super friendly breakfast spot w/ unbeatable prices.   I've stopped here a few times when in town, and haven't been disappointed. Great way to start the day.

WmL3D971A3xE4Q1Aiz5vKw.text: Definitely a hidden gem. Great food, huge portions. Probably the best grits I've ever had. My advice.... split a meal.

y-pbPih8uKof5_KRkyAiUQ.text: Huge portions! Typical diner feel and food. The pancakes are gynormous! We shared one, and had to take the other home. I ordered the turkey sausage and cheese omelette, it was just ok. The fried apple sticks are like a not-so-guilty pleasure in the middle of breakfast. I'd order those as a dessert. The grits didn't need any extra salt or pepper. And the rye toast was really good too.  We shall return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey sausage and cheese omelette, fried apple sticks and rye toast.
Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs, sausage, grits, pancakes and peaches

kAouc5-8niheAUqum0kocw.text: Okay, here is the deal with Sunflower Family Restaurant: The service is very fast, efficient, and pleasant. We really enjoyed our meal there. The food was hot, homemade, and full of flavor (especially salt -- everything is seasoned very, very well). The portions are enormous, but don't think about splitting that meal -- It'll cost you. I enjoyed the Country Fried Chicken. The fried squash was more than passable, but was the one thing that could have used a little more seasoning. The mac and cheese was so creamy, but could have used more of a cheese flavor and less of a milk flavor. The pancakes are huge but delicious. The banana pudding is also fresh and right on the money in terms of what you would hope it would be like.   This is a tightly run family restaurant and they have their own ideas as to what hospitality is and what they will and will not allow.   1. Don't ask for plasticware or expect to eat something to-go inside the restaurant.  2. Don't ask or expect substitutions. You will have what they offer.  3. The management is usually inflexible when it comes to the rules they have established for their restaurant. 4. You must pay if you want to split that entree.   Now here is my rub... if you want to have all of these rules and guidelines in regards to your service, please place it on a sign and let people know right from the beginning. That way you will have less irritable customers and probably have happier servers too!

VTPA3aXVNZ4SehDeGQM7kw.text: Better than IHOP! Waiters are friendly, workers treat you with respect. I definitely recommend this family restaurant. Food is excellent and tasty (:

udZfb-gjsarR4zdOBHJvUw.text: This restaurant is awesome, great food ,fast and great service and also some of the best prices I have seen for the amount of food you get. I'm still trying to get everything on the menu at least once lol.

giLaehU53PLun_19xAndRQ.text: This was my first visit and I took my mom for breakfast there on Wednesday. The food and service was fantastic!!!!  I had the French Toast and my bacon was cooked to perfection exactly the way I asked.  My mom had the corned beef hash, eggs with grits, fruit, etc. and just loved it.  She raved about the great coffee as well.  The food and service was way better than Metro Diner that I think is overrated just because of the location.  But what made it so special for us was our server Brittany!  She was so sweet, attentive and professional all dressed for St. Patty's Day!  This place is a small family diner, but everyone was warm, pleasant and the whole experience definitely made me feel like I was at home. Good food, clean and great prices!  Keep up the good work and we will definitely be back as your favorite regulars.    Ray C.

LFTKGiXNU0660hBXw3l57g.text: GRITS GRITS GRITS! The most amazing Grits I've ever had! Usually you have to modify your grits by adding butter and sugar and more butter and sugar, BUT I can tell you that you will not have any issues enjoying these grits.    The diner is small, clean and very friendly as everyone seems to know each other by first name. A very refreshing sight to see! All the servers are great and very attentive and the breakfast was perfect! I can only imagine how good their lunch is. I will definitely make sure I come back for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Sunflower Family Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. If your grits don&#39;t have this lovely yellow color, you ain&#39;t eating good grits! Welcome to Charlotte!

QynQbH-QcSC11BPZ8w_WNg.text: Just around the corner from my house. Affordable and good breakfast spot. Their whiting and grits surpassed my expectations. The service is super pleasant. They are closed for 3 weeks. Annually they close to allow their staff to vacation. Call before you go to ensure they are open.

VVOMtzBvPZ1XjBRzQSWv7w.text: If you love Southern style food Sunflower Family Restaurant is a must try! If this is your first time visiting, trust me you will definitely return.
